p:
The factors determining TSCs differ from region to region. Between the regions with the latest TSCs, all of
m max ,
m end , and
ϵ exhibit greater magnitudes in the Arctic than in low latitudes. While these regions display similar signal‐to‐noise ratios, the Arctic steadies at a much higher 23rd century warming rate. Low latitudes take a similarly long time to reach steady change but stabilize at a low
m end .
